comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Konstantin Dumba He was the last Austro-Hungarian Ambassador to the United States. On 9 September 1915, Secretary of State Lansing declared him no longer acceptable and requested the Austro-Hungarian government to recall its ambassador. In the note, Lansing charged the ambassador with espionage for having advocated that his government back 'plans to instigate strikes in American manufacturing plants engaged in the production of munitions of war'. On 27 September, the Austro-Hungarian government eventually agreed to recall Dr. Dumba. He left the United States on 5 October. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Konstantin_Dumba
